abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome is rated as
            unsatisfactory, because, despite the achievements of
            physical objectives, the National Power Corporation
            maintained a precarious financial situation, with a
            consequent negative net present value, which restrains the
            economics of the project, thus sustainability remains
            uncertain. The lessons specify that although quick
            Build-Operate-Transfer operations in the power sector, may
            be crucial to alleviate power shortages, prudential
            investment, and financial planning, as well as risk
            management should be considered to attain a cohesive
            sectoral approach, within a competitive, price
            rationalization framework. Only in the first few years of
            operation, were there any economic benefits, because power
            was scarce, and the value of avoiding outages, was high;
            thus, the quantification of benefits, and estimates of the
            economic rate of return, was critically dependent on the
            estimated value of "unserved" energy, in contrast
            to the conventional economic rate of return analysis.
            Furthermore, the use of a "rate of return on
            assets" target for financial performance, is
            inappropriate for a company, or sector with vast, and
            uncertain investment programs. The report re-emphasizes the
            importance to maintain staff continuity, particularly in
            complex operations, and avoid multiple implementing
            agencies, given the potential for diversity performance.
